toc_entry.title: Special Delivery
toc_entry.description: Morsels by mail, potables by post—let Texas’ mail-order food companies set your holiday table.

toc_entry.title: Deep In the Heart Of Mexico
toc_entry.description: What’s wrong with Mexico is exactly what’s right with it.

toc_entry.title: The Louie File
toc_entry.description: Just how good were the good ol' days, when Louie Welch was mayor of Houston?.

toc_entry.title: The Kathy Ratings
toc_entry.description: Kathy Whitmire’s substantial achievements as mayor of Houston are overshadowed by her bad public image and political ineptitude—not a good situation for a candidate seeking a third term.

toc_entry.title: The Wishbone Offense
toc_entry.subtitle: Texas Primer
toc_entry.description: Darrell Royal’s supremely simple invention took Texas teams to the top and kept them there.

toc_entry.title: Tower Play
toc_entry.description: Houston’s Transco Tower can’t hide from a camera bent on seeing it from every vantage point.

toc_entry.title: The Chips Are Down
toc_entry.description: The real Texas technology picture is much more intricate than either the mad hype of two years ago or the dire headlines of today make it out to be.

toc_entry.title: The Dream Lives On
toc_entry.description: Four of the many small high-tech companies betting that they have the excitement, mpmentum, market, and business savvy to succeed where others have failed.

toc_entry.title: When the Well Runs Dry
toc_entry.description: In parts of Texas drought is a steady boarder who may stray but always comes home for supper.

toc_entry.title: Beyond The Standard
toc_entry.subtitle: Jazz
toc_entry.description: Those who think there’s nothing new under the sun should check out the superior jazz improvisations on three recently released albums.

toc_entry.title: True To The Past
toc_entry.subtitle: Classical Music
toc_entry.description: Forget all that debate about early instruments versus modern ones for eighteenth-century music.

toc_entry.title: Hill Country Pearls
toc_entry.subtitle: Outdoors
toc_entry.description: Real treasure lies buried in the muddy, mushy silt of our rivers and lakes.

toc_entry.title: Waxy Buildup
toc_entry.subtitle: Movies
toc_entry.description: Plenty isn’t enough; Year of the Dragon is yellow-devil hysteria; uncompromised casting makes Compromising Positions click; Volunteers imposes eighties cynicism on sixties idealism.

toc_entry.title: Dancing In the Streets
toc_entry.subtitle: Popular Music
toc_entry.description: Tuff Enuff, the Fabulous Thunderbirds’ fifth and finest album, has a snap, crackle, and pop that could finally make the T-Birds explode.

toc_entry.title: Back Roads
toc_entry.description: Robots in feedlots, Krishnas as cowboys. Nowhere but Texas.

toc_entry.title: Post-Modern Times
toc_entry.description: Today’s with-it seniors are settling in America’s newest retirement boomtown—Kerrville.

toc_entry.title: Downtown
toc_entry.description: The maddest crowd in town? The incensed citizens at the Dallas Auto Pound who have to shell out for the privilege of reclaiming their towed vehicles.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective statewide guide to entertainment and events.

toc_entry.title: Reporter
toc_entry.description: The villains behind the seat belt law; the shoeshine boys behind the border bird trade; the pastor behind Austin’s chicest church.

toc_entry.title: Touts
toc_entry.description: Look! Up in the sky! It’s a bird! It’s a plane! It’s . . . Halley’s Comet!.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: Rough sailing for the water plan; sore losers at Mhmr; a free ride for Mattox; now a word on behalf of ambulance chasing.
